titles.title: To amend the Truth in Lending Act to require a store in which a consumer may apply to open a credit or charge card account to display a sign, at each location where the application may be made, containing the same information required by such Act to be prominently placed in a tabular format on the application.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services

bill.summary: 3/27/2000--Introduced. Amends the Truth in Lending Act to require the conspicuous display in tabular format of mandatory consumer credit disclosures at each location on business premises where a credit or charge card application under an open end credit plan may be submitted by the consumer.
